name: Emerging Enterprise Center at Foley Hoag
tag_list: entrepreneurs, venture-capital, vc, legal-service, funding, law-firm, start-ups, business-advice
overview:
The Emerging Enterprise Center at Foley Hoag (EEC) serves the wide-ranging needs of Greater Bostonâ€™s entrepreneur and venture communities by providing timely and efficient delivery of a full complement of legal services and widening access to business management expertise and professional networks. The EEC provides a forum where entrepreneurs and industry thought leaders convene to exchange ideas and accelerate the progress of emerging enterprises. The EEC is located in the heart of the Route 128 technology corridor, an area ranked number one in the state in entrepreneurial start-ups for the past decade, according to the Waltham Chamber of Commerce.

The EEC brings together Foley Hoag lawyers from all areas of practice in support of our regionâ€™s entrepreneurial and venture capital community. With our roots deep in Greater Bostonâ€™s technology sectors, this positions us closer to our clients and the organizations with whom we do business.

The EEC is designed to be a center of innovation and a destination to which members of the entrepreneurial and venture communities can visit to obtain legal services, network with peers and hear the latest industry trends and developments. The EEC focuses on key priorities for any emerging technology company: patent protection and strategy, corporate organization and governance, financing and deals. It also serves as a state-of-the-art venue offering seminars, programs and events to facilitate learning, collaboration and networking among industry organizations. It offers a means of connecting key people, stimulating ideas and growing businesses.
